page.title: 07TWO FILGRAVE FARMS
page.content: MANOR FARM AND RECTORY FARM BOTH LIE IN THE PARISH OF TYRINGHAM CUM FILGRAVE. MANOR FARM HAS AN AVERAGE DAIRY HERD OF 110.ALL MILK IS SOLD TO THE MILK MARKETING BOARD.WHEAT IS THE MAIN CROP AND IS SOLD TO A VARIETY OF MERCHANTS, MAINLY DALGETYS OF ROYSTON AND QUENBY OF TURVEY.THE FARM HAS 405 ACRES AND EMPLOYS 3 LABOURERS WITH EXTRA AT BUSY TIMES. RECTORY FARM HAS BEEN IN THE PRESENT OWNERS HANDS SINCE 1939.MAIN CROPS ARE BARLEY AND WHEAT BUT NO DAIRY HERD.USED TO HAVE ONE BUT NOW ONLY BEEF HERD.OVER THE YEARS HAS SEEN A DRASTIC REDUCTION IN BOTH CROP AND ANIMAL DISEASES AND HAS TAKEN UP SOME HEDGEROWS TO AID USE OF LARGE MACHINERY BUT BELIEVES THAT AS FAR AS POSSIBLE HEDGEROWS SHOULD BE PRESERVED OR EVEN RENEWED. BOTH FARMERS COMMENT ON DECLINING SENSE OF COMMUNITY IN THE VILLAGE.
